job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Rome, GA

cons: 1. Managers in their role because of "who you know" rather than based on their actual skill sets and abilities. 2. Extreme bias on side of locals. I witnessed several non-native to Rome staff being treated differently and negatively, even when issues ended with HR involvement. (HR very biased.) 3. Pay is abhorrent. It was almost the same as what I earned straight out of school 25 yrs prior.

pros: Wonderful co-workers. Always helpful to new Nurse and New employees. Amazing place to gain experience and feel like you are apart of a family.  Able to go to management of all levels and can even get directly in touch with the CEO if you want. Floyd has and is making changes to keep up with Atl pay scales.  I have seen many people leave and many of them come back. Overall for the location, lack of traffic, experience, Pay and friends/Family...couldn’t ask for a better gig.
cons: I’m not sure there are cons here that aren’t your typical cons with any job...sometimes have a couple people that get moody but who doesn’t get that way from time to time in a high stress work place? Some complain about the insurance but in my experience it’s not horrible.

pros: Great coworkers who work well together. Nice location between Atlanta and Chattanooga and they work on improvements regularly
cons: Nurses are under paid this III s the lost pi dying hospital in the greater Northwest Georgia area. The health benefits are very expensive and don't offer great coverage.

review_title: One of the best healthcare facilities in Georgia.
pros: The organization has excellent leadership; strong sense of vision, stewardship and accountability.  Six Sigma initatives have been good for the organization, providing a strong corporate culture that roots out waste and improves procedures.  My favorable review is due in large part due to Kurt Stuenkel's leadership.  The personality of an organization often is based on the leader's attributes.   It has definitely taken on his personality.
cons: Salary isn't as competitive since it is just outside the Atlanta market.

review_title: Just come in and keep your head down.
pros: You will always get to work if you are a full time employee. If you work the morning shift on the floor you will always be staffed.
cons: You do not get holiday pay. If you work nights they won't staff correctly most night.

review_title: Bottom line for management bonus is more important than patient care
pros: No competition and will probably be around
cons: Took over Polk Medical Center and nothing but cuts. Don't even know employees name. Had someone retire in housekeeping after 30 years and never missed a day of work with admin team given nothing on retirement party   and then not even knowing her name. ED major money maker and staff treated  badly with long term community people that care looking to leave. Don't want to cover the poor people in Polk county.  Big bosses coming in with personal agenda.

job_title: Information Technology Service Desk Technician in Rome, GA
pros: Great staff. Current technology. Always growing. I have worked at this hospital for 12 years. It has grown so much. I started out in the Pharmacy and transferred to the IT department after 9 years. We have moved closer to being completely paper free. We also gained Polk hospital. We try to stay current on the health technology available.
cons: The raise scale. Average raise is 3%.

job_title: Behavioral Health Security Officer in Rome, GA
pros: Manager would bend over backwards to give me a full-time schedule that worked around school.
cons: Offered certification as a hospital security officer. I studied hard only to find out that the department would not schedule me to take the test. Also, I could not use my Master's degree in Psychology once I got it.
